intro: Ranunculus limosus, commonly known as the marsh buttercup, is a herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas across Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five to eight petals, typically surrounded by a ring of sepals that resemble petals. The plant has a short, stout stem and heart-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds. Ranunculus limosus is an important species in wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and aquatic organisms.
